newsitem.title: SPAIN: PESETA DEBT/INTERBANK MARKET CLOSING REPORT.
newsitem.headline: PESETA DEBT/INTERBANK MARKET CLOSING REPORT.

text.p: Spanish government bonds ended a quiet session higher on Monday, following other markets as no fresh factors emerged domestically, dealers said.
"Bonds have gone through the day without pain or glory. We are depending on foreign bonds and we don't have anything new," an analyst said.
But the market is looking ahead to domestic consumer price data on Wednesday and the regular repo auction at the Bank of Spain on Thursday.
"If CPI is 1.6 percent as forecast then there is no reason to expect anything from the central bank," the analyst said.
The market expects the next Spanish rate cut to follow the government's official presentation to Congress of the 1998 budget.
Abroad, the market is looking to the Bundesbank repo on Tuesday for hints on the future of monetary policy in Germany.
